Package com.example.lapuile.wearsensor.handlers

Class HandleAPICalls

java.lang.Object
com.example.lapuile.wearsensor.handlers.HandleAPICalls
@Path("/kaa")
public class HandleAPICalls
extends java.lang.Object
Class that allows you to directly respond to calls to the API defined in this project /kaa/scan to get the "dataNames" for every endpoint in a tree structure /kaa/sensors/{endpointIds} to get the "dataNames" of the specified endpoints /kaa/sensor/{endpointId}{dataName} to check the availability of the sensor "dataName" in the specified endpoint /kaa/play to get all the data of the last 24 hours in JSON format /kaa/play/{params} to get data with custom parameters /kaa/store/{data} to store the specified data in the platform

  • Constructor Summary

    HandleAPICalls()

  • Method Details

    • scan

      @GET @Path("scan") @Produces("application/json") public java.lang.String scan()
      Function to "retrieve" the names of the values that the Kaa application is receiving
      Returns:
      JSON mappable with the KaaApplication model

    • sensors

      @GET @Path("sensors") @Produces("application/json") public java.lang.String sensors​(@QueryParam("endpointId") java.lang.String endpointId)
      Function to "retrieve" the names of the values that the Kaa application is receiving
      Parameters:
      endpointId - EndpointIDs whose data you want to retrieve (endpointIds separated with ,)
      Returns:
      JSON mappable with the KaaApplication model

    • sensor

      @GET @Path("sensor") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response sensor​(@QueryParam("endpointId") java.lang.String endpointId, @QueryParam("dataName") java.lang.String dataName)
      Function to check the availability of the sensor "dataName" in the specified endpoint. If more than one endpoint is specified, then it checks only the first one
      Parameters:
      endpointId - EndpointID whose data you want to retrieve
      dataName - sensor name to check for availability within the endpointId
      Returns:
      HTTP response. OK/200 if the sensor exists within the endpoint. 404 otherwise.

    • playAll

      @GET @Path("play") @Produces("application/json") public java.lang.String playAll() throws java.lang.Exception
      Function to get all the data of the last 24 hours in JSON format
      Returns:
      All data of all endpoints from the last 24 hours in JSON format
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If is not possible to retrieve the data from Kaa

    • play

      @GET @Path("play") @Produces("text/plain") public java.lang.String play​(@QueryParam("kaaEndpointConfigurations") java.lang.String kaaEndpointConfigurations, @QueryParam("fromDate") long fromDate, @QueryParam("toDate") long toDate, @QueryParam("includeTime") java.lang.String includeTime, @QueryParam("sort") java.lang.String sort, @QueryParam("format") java.lang.String format, @QueryParam("periodSample") long periodSample)
      Function to get data from Kaa with custom parameters
      Parameters:
      kaaEndpointConfigurations - encoded JSON (KaaEndpointsConfigurationsFormatter.KaaEndpointConfigurationsToJSON) that tells the API which data retrieve for which endpoint
      fromDate - "Date" from which to retrieve the data
      toDate - "Date" up to which to recover the data
      includeTime - defines whether fromDate and toDate are inclusive [from, to, both, none]
      sort - data sorting [ASC, DESC]
      format - JSON, CSV, XML
      periodSample - The data sampling period
      Returns:
      output in the desired format

    • store

      @POST @Path("store") @Consumes("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response store​(java.lang.String data)
      Function to store the specified data in the platform
      Parameters:
      data - JSON obtained from the function KaaEndpoint.toJson()
      Returns:
      HTTP response representing the result of the operation (if operation completed successfully OK / 200)
